website_summaries.verdict: A good choice for budget-minded consumers. Has quality features for a value price.
pros: Stainless steel blade is easy to remove and clean
Comes with a carving fork and storage case
cons: Some say that the on-off button is awkward to use

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Carving Knife for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I got this to cut the foam on my gun case. It does that kind of a thing really well. It may not be obvious, but there are dual blades in his carving knife. If you wanted it for carving meat, I am sure it would do that as well. Gun case foam is a lot harder to trim than one would expect. Scissors don't work worth spit. This thing just slides right through it. In full disclosure, I got the idea from youtube. Thank you youtube.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: First time I used it, it was to cut ...
customer_reviews.text: First time I used it, it was to cut a squash in half, and the knife bogged down and became hot. With plenty of pressure and fiddling with it, I finally got through. It was awkward to hold and use, as my thumb wanted to go to the top of the unit while holding, which is exactly where the blade eject button is! I had been using a Black & Decker electric knife that my husband purchased for me, fifteen years ago, cutting through squash and other items without a problem. It finally gave out, and I should've stuck with that brand. I am returning this item and reordering the Black & Decker model.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Don't know how I did without?
customer_reviews.text: We haven't had an electric knife since about 1971. I have forgotten just how convenient these tools are! We find this item very useful and it comes with a storage case that makes storing it much simpler. I have only one complaint. The handle is very smooth and slick and my hand tends to travel forward making pressing the "ON" button difficult. I have to occasionally move my hand back on the handle. If they had made it a little less smooth and given it some texture, it would be easier to hang onto.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah L. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Very Poor Deaign
customer_reviews.text: The handle is fat and very smooth, which makes it very difficult to hold onto. Add to that the fact that the power button has to be slid down, instead of pressed in, this knife is practically impossible to use. Maybe a guy with big hands could handle it, but my smallish female hands were in pain before I even finished the job. Another dubious feature is that the blades are very thin & flexible, which makes it hard to cut a consistent slice. I would not recommend this knife.
customer_reviews.author: B. Butler

customer_reviews.title: It cuts OK, not great or bad, but wasn't comfortable to hold or use.
customer_reviews.text: It cuts OK, not great, not bad... just OK. The tip cutting is not good when I compare it to electric knives I owned in the past, so positioning for the cut takes a little pre-thought that I was not expecting. The part that was really disappointing was the safety switch/trigger configuration. Between the shape of the actual button, and the direction you need to press to operate the knife, you find you hand position to be awkward, and counter intuitive which makes it an odd feel in the hand as you use it. Also, the button became uncomfortable to hold down when doing longer cutting sessions.
customer_reviews.author: Bob O.

customer_reviews.title: Very good turkey carver
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use on big turkey. Blade just long enough. Plenty power. Press blades in place hard. Box space is tight for blade, handle, cord, instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Very useful even if used only a few times a year!
customer_reviews.text: Cooked my first turkeys last year and watched a YouTube video about how to carve to get the most turkey and they used a carver. So worth it to have one of these and impressive at the table. Makes carving so fast and easy and doesn't require you to saw so you avoid squeezing out any juices. Also used it on a Bobby Flay prime rib recipe I cooked for the first time and it came out so beautifully. Totally worth it even if you use it a few times a year. Other nearby family will definitely want to borrow. I just store it with the roaster and thermometer I use for cooking big meat dishes.
customer_reviews.author: OrdersALot

customer_reviews.title: This is a gorgeous knife.
customer_reviews.text: This knife looks like a very expensive knife and has a lovely case . I purchased this for myself but the kids loved it so much at thanksgiving i got one for each of them for Christmas. This knife would make a great wedding gift without breaking the bank. Very sleek modern look.
customer_reviews.author: wild wild woman

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't appear to be high quality
customer_reviews.text: I guess I'm use to $60 to $100 filet knives and thought I'd try a cheap one since my original Hamilton Beach last 20 years. I except this one to be tossed in the trash after a few fishing trips. It rattles and feels like it may fall apart in my hand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Adequate for some jobs
customer_reviews.text: Have only had the knife for two days and only used it for one job: to slice up a whole ham. Grip and controls seem to be acceptable. However, the knife did not do well on the ham. Had to apply a significant amount of downward pressure, as well as employ a back-and-forth sawing action, in order to achieve reasonable cutting speed. (Yes, the knife was running at the time!) The blades deflect upward at the handle when the downward pressure to achieve cutting is applied. On a positive note, the fork seems exceptionally well-made. If given a "do-over", would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: R. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Poor physical design.
customer_reviews.text: The knife operates well enough, but I find using it for any length of time is difficult. The body is too big and slick for my hands to grasp comfortably, so I have to exert too much force in the grip causing my forearms discomfort. Also, one must pull the switch backwards instead of compressing it, making it even more difficult to operate.
customer_reviews.author: Bob K

customer_reviews.title: I am make finger tea sandwiches. I freeze the ...
customer_reviews.text: I am make finger tea sandwiches. I freeze the bread. Then I cut two slices of frozen bread. The knife won't cut through two slices. I let the bread thaw. The knife will cut two slices. When I put the chicken salad between the 2 slices of bread, it won't cut. The knife over heats. It trips the electrical current. The design does not let the knife get closer to the bread. I have to tilt the knife fr cutting. I have had a Hamilton Beach electric knife for twenty years. It cut through most everything. I put the knife into the black container and disposed of it. I could not even donated it to the thrift shore.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Ochoa

customer_reviews.title: love it!
customer_reviews.text: All these years I have served holiday turkeys and roasts by hand carving, which takes a long time. I don't know why I never bought one of these electric carvers. The slices are beautiful. It takes less time to get the meat to the table
customer_reviews.author: Tirefire123

customer_reviews.title: Alright!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty nice unit and it works great. It also has its own storage box that fits nicely into a small drawer! We had to retire ours, which was a wedding gift 27 years ago! lol. Happy to have found this.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie P.

customer_reviews.title: OK Knife
customer_reviews.text: None of the electric knives are really good. This is no better or worse than the rest of them. Works OK so far. I don't think it will last long. It gets hot easily and struggles on tough cuts. The on off switch is particularly annoying. Instead of pressing the switch with your finger, you have to pull the button back. This is difficult to do while trying to hold the knife and make a cut. The switch often slips. Maybe I will get use to it.
customer_reviews.author: Jerseytom

customer_reviews.title: Cannot Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Not very powerful and requires considerable pressure downward to cut a loaf of bread. The wattage was not listed on website but on product it says 100w. I think a knife with 200-250 watts would probably work okay. The storage box this came in had irregularities on the box--not scratches but variations in the color of the plastic. This would have been okay if the knife had been adequate to the job. I am returning this and will probably look for a W Puck or Cuisinart with higher wattage.
customer_reviews.author: R. Springer

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the first time to slice a pork loin into chops - it did okay, not great. It had a hard time cutting through the fat cap and required a little extra effort on my part. It's a decent knife for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Macleandowdy

customer_reviews.title: Great companion for a bread maker.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Bought for slicing bread, and it obviously cuts through that quite well. No issues. It comes with a storage case that holds the blades, the knife, and the included large fork. So far, so good. If I have any issues, I will update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Allen C. Huffman

customer_reviews.title: Replacing a 50-plus Hamilton Beach "hole in the handle" knife.
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace an OLD Hamilton Beach that died. Same good quality and good cutting. Sliced the Thanksgiving turkey. Did a great job. I do miss the hole in the handle, as I have fairly small hands. Other than that, it's a very good product.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Mansfield

customer_reviews.title: blade is poor quality
customer_reviews.text: The blade bends as you use it, the flexing of the blade causes the slice to curve off center. I tried several times using very little pressure. My older electric knife worked for years, so I do know how to use one. This is just not a good blade.
customer_reviews.author: JerzShoreBear

customer_reviews.title: Handle much too wide
customer_reviews.text: Everything in this purchase was perfect except the size of the handle of this knife. It is far larger than I expected and much too large for comfortable cutting in my opinion. The vertical depth isn't as objectionable as the horizontal width. I wear large gloves, so I don't have small hands. For me the design of the handle is inferior and I don't believe much thought was given to how unfavorable the size factor could be. I dislike ever having to return an item but this I did return and there were NO problems whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Mooney

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work well on foam
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for an upholstery project to cut some upholstery foam. It worked for a few cuts but not very well. Might work well for turkey but not so much on foam.
customer_reviews.author: Pdelatorre

customer_reviews.title: Knife blades are flimsy and I  feel dangerous.
customer_reviews.text: This knife is dangerous. The blades do not fit tightly into the handle. I had it come apart while trying to carve with it 3 times an gave up. I would rather keep my fingers. The blades are very flimsy and bend easily. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: deborah

customer_reviews.title: Great drive and case to protect it
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely live this the case to keep it in what a great idea because I always kept my old one in the box got real beat up over the years so this is a welcome update
customer_reviews.author: Debby

customer_reviews.title: Broke after first use
customer_reviews.text: Used once to carve turkeys. Cleaned according to directions. Brought out a couple of weeks later and the blades will not stay together when carving. Basically a useless piece of junk If I had kept the box I'd be sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I have been wanting an Electric Knife for sometime now and I'm glad I waited. This is everything they said it would been and well worth the price
customer_reviews.author: jeb

customer_reviews.title: As expected, comfortable to use, could be a little large for the misses
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this electric knife once at a 2018 Christmas party. It carved the Turkey and ham very nicely. I could be a little big if my wife used it. For me it was comfortable. Easy clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Joey Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Great knife
customer_reviews.text: This knife is awesome! Works so well on Prime Rib for carving thin slices for French Dip sandwiches. Nice for big roasts!!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Ducharme

customer_reviews.title: So-far-so-good.
customer_reviews.text: Needed to replace one (same brand) that was 40+ years-old. Only used it a couple of time, thus-far, but so-far-so-good. Hope that it holds up well.
customer_reviews.author: JFC05

customer_reviews.title: Nightmare product
customer_reviews.text: Yes, I realize that it was inexpensive but I at least expected something fit for purpose. Exactly one minute into using this knife the handle became so hot it could not even be held. At best, this product is a piece of garbage out of the box. At worst, it's a fire hazard that could easily lead to a disaster. It should be removed from the market, let alone Amazon. Ps, I obviously would have given zero stars but it made me give at least one to submit a review.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Lifer

customer_reviews.title: Don't look for another. This the machine
customer_reviews.text: This unit is quiet and doesn't vibrate like my old one. Good looking container it came with. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Blazzing 7

customer_reviews.title: IT TAKES A GORILLA TO HOLD THE SWITCH AND USE THIS KNIFE!!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT PURCHASE THIS KNIFE! While it cuts well, there no longer is a pushbutton to active it, and the slider switch is so poorly positioned and hard to use that it takes a GORILLA to use it! My wife couldn't even activate the knife! Hamilton Beach, this is a BAD BAD BAD DESIGN [for the switch] - having to hold back on a slide switch while cutting is downright DANGEROUS!!! What possible reason could there be for removing the pushbutton these units USED to hav
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Carves great
customer_reviews.text: It carved my prime rib perfectly. Very easy to use and clean. It has a nice case to store it in.
customer_reviews.author: Purple Dot

customer_reviews.title: Holds Well, easy to maneuver but gets warm in heavy use
customer_reviews.text: I have used an electric knife for years to clean fish, my old knife went out and I needed a replacement. unfortunately this did not meet my needs. The knife gets extremely warm during heavy use, I don't want to be overly critical of the product because what I used it for may not be its intended design. I do believe this knife would work well for lighter uses.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great Knife for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this electric carving knife as a gift for my sister and brother-in-law, and they absolutely love it. It is a high-quality knife, especially for the price. The blades are easy to remove for cleaning and storage. It is very easy to control, and it makes slices according to preference - even ultra-thin. It cuts through thick roasts, ham, turkey and other meats as if they were butter.
customer_reviews.author: BlueCrystal

customer_reviews.title: Bread
customer_reviews.text: I bake a dozen or so loaves of bread every three weeks. Slicing by hand is excruciating and my husband and I usually argue over who should do it. I bought this knife based on other's reviews and I am not disappointed. It allows us to slice perfect slices every time. It does get hot after two loaves and needs a little time out.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Dissatisfy
customer_reviews.text: Not pleased at all. Used it for the first time and it got hot and stopped working. Smelled like it burned an element.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overheats. Large handle
customer_reviews.text: Large handle. Overheats while cutting a large turkey. Control switch hard to keep on . Do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Boston

customer_reviews.title: Good and stable knife that works well.
customer_reviews.text: I really love this knife and it worked well during the Christmas holidays. It is a little heavier than my last one which makes it easier to cut exact slices. It is a stable knife and never hesitates like some knives. This is my 3rd one and I like it more than all the others.
customer_reviews.author: Jane crosby

customer_reviews.title: Love this electric knife
customer_reviews.text: This purchase was everything I expected and I would purchase it again
customer_reviews.author: Gary Miller

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: The one star rating is for the fork and case that were included with this knife. The electric knife is horrible. The handle becomes too hot after a few minutes use, the blades small, thin, and ineffective, the handle is cumbersome to use, and the push button is oddly placed and difficult to use. After 2 uses, this knife goes in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: ELLEN SKRADSKI

customer_reviews.title: good value
customer_reviews.text: This electric knife is a good value for the money. It cleans easily and comes with it's own storage case.
customer_reviews.author: C. White

customer_reviews.title: Good Deal!
customer_reviews.text: I recommend this knife it is easy to use and cleans up quickly, nice one!
customer_reviews.author: Geselle

customer_reviews.title: I was disappointed in the trigger mechanism
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed in the trigger mechanism. You have to pull it backward instead of squeeze it. It was so uncomfortable I had to go buy a different one. The motor and blade length are great.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Magrogan

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Didn't cut. The knife I was going to replace cut better than this one.
customer_reviews.author: sandra fauser

customer_reviews.title: Complete garbage
customer_reviews.text: Gets super hot and had trouble slicing through a perfectly tender brisket. Additionally, the design was hard to hold on to. Zero stars if I could, total trash.
customer_reviews.author: Soraya

customer_reviews.title: The blade is flimsy and it doesn't cut easily (not very sharp)
customer_reviews.text: The blade is flimsy and it doesn't cut easily (not very sharp). The neck of the knife is too wide and you have to hold down the "on" button for it to work. The result is very uncomfortable cutting, and uneven and partially mangled slices. It is compact and easy to stow. But I am very dissatisfied by the capacity and performance of this electric knife. I have owned much better, in Europe.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great electric knife. It is a comfortable fit in the hand. The cord never gets in the way of the blades. It is very easy to clean. Additionally, it has a fantastic storage case. The knife and blades store in the case which fits easily in a drawer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comes in a roomy plastic case.
customer_reviews.text: Its easy to use, clean and store. it does get very warm with continuous uses.
customer_reviews.author: George A Rieder Jr

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in cutting ability
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to cut crusty no-knead bread, and It doesn’t cut as easily as I had hoped. Not as easy to hold and handle easily. I wouldn’t recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia Mills

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in Hamilton Beach
customer_reviews.text: this is a pile of junk according to my husband. The blades would not stay together; the knife would not cut,etc.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy U. Lazarus

customer_reviews.title: Hard to hold and difficult to store
customer_reviews.text: There is no lock button and it’s difficult to hold. It is not comfortable in the hand and difficult to store in the case.
customer_reviews.author: LeAnn Richards

customer_reviews.title: Best electric knife for cutting ham
customer_reviews.text: Best electric knife for cutting ham ,turkey or roast beef. I had the same brand for years I actually received it for a wedding gift. Finally broke After 32 years. So we were thrilled they carried the same brand but even better because it has a carry case. Which we use when we go to ,y sisters for Thanksgiving because my husband seems to be the official carver of the turkey.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Makes carving simple!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great on Thanksgiving Turkey. If you have a smaller hand...it may be a bit too large to control
customer_reviews.author: michael d

customer_reviews.title: It works fine but last time I cut a roast beef
customer_reviews.text: It works fine but last time I cut a roast beef, it seemed flimsier than the last one we had. The trigger for operating the knife hurt my finger a little. Like the case that it comes it -makes storage easy.
customer_reviews.author: ErinP

customer_reviews.title: Not for slicing meat.
customer_reviews.text: I do not know how good this knife is for slicing bread, but on pot roast it surrendered. Instead of slices, it shredded and overheated. Worthless for me.
customer_reviews.author: Bye Bye to Books

customer_reviews.title: Nice knife
customer_reviews.text: Very nicely built. Works as described. Gets a little warm after extended use. Bought it to cut foam rubber and ut works very well for that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A perfect gift for Men and Women
customer_reviews.text: It was a gift for my neighbor. He loves it. He smoked a rib roast, and used it, and he said it was the best gift he could get. :)
customer_reviews.author: ladydragon

customer_reviews.title: Knife worked for 30 seconds and burned out
customer_reviews.text: Started cutting some soft Costco turkey breast slices, using the knife gently, and motor started slowing down within 20 seconds. By 30 seconds, it died entirely, with electrical smell coming from housing. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: TimD

customer_reviews.title: Handle to large
customer_reviews.text: Did not like this electric knife Handle is to large. I had to use both hands so would not recommend for someone with small hands
customer_reviews.author: Chris Sellers

customer_reviews.title: Very light-weight
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a nice product! Easy to use and it is light-weight. This was purchased to replace a 24-year-old electric knife...good luck Hamilton Beach!
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Williams

customer_reviews.title: This product sucks...
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this. I bought it 3 months ago and used it twice and it overheated and doesn't work. I was cutting 2 flank steaks and was only using it for no more that 10 minutes when it seized up. I called Hamilton and was on hold for 15 minutes and then I hung up and threw it out. 20 bucks isn't worth the time.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Babich

customer_reviews.title: Great Knife for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this knife for my wife since she has problems with her hands and it is working as expected. The functioning is the same as a more expensive knife and I can't be more pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Luisma1955

customer_reviews.title: Present for husband
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this knife to cut his bbq. He is able to get nice thin slices without tearing through the fall apart/ melt in your mouth meat.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent electric knife makes Thanksgiving a dream
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Hamilton Beach Electric Knife just in time for Thanksgiving. Oh my, I love this knife! It was my first time carving a Turkey, and with some instruction from an experienced friend on the tactics, this knife really made this experience a joy. Everyone was able to have consistent slices, and I was able to serve the meal quickly. Best purchase... period.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Have owned a Hamilton Beach electric knife for the past 39 years and while it was still working I thought it was time for a new one. Since my past experience with Hamilton Beach was good, I bought the same brand. So far the new one works perfectly and does an excellent job. I like the easy to hold shape and it is easy to maneuver.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hinton

customer_reviews.title: Great for holidays
customer_reviews.text: I guess I scored points with this purchase as my son used it to slice our Christmas Day Ham.
customer_reviews.author: Melody A. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great electric knife
customer_reviews.text: This is a great carving knife. Used it to slice turkey bird on Thanksgiving, a 1/2 ham, and an 8 lb beef brisket recently. Easy to use and clean. Comes with its own storage container. I have an electric slicer, but sometimes one just needs a good electric knife....this it it!
customer_reviews.author: Sue McConnell

customer_reviews.title: Great help for the Cook!!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and does a great job of slicing through all kinds of roasts without shredding the meat. Fits my hand well and is comfortable to use. Easy clean up. The blades go in the top rack of the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer  from Georgia

customer_reviews.title: On each occasion the blades have separated and allowed meat to stop the easy process that is the reason we purchase a specialty
customer_reviews.text: I bought this knife in May to replace a Carving Knife I had for two decades. We have used the knife three times with turkey, pork, and beef roasts. On each occasion the blades have separated and allowed meat to stop the easy process that is the reason we purchase a specialty knife. The blades are thin and poorly constructed. It is too late for a return......but not too late to warn someone who is looking for a useful appliance....this is a very poor choice.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Audette

customer_reviews.title: Poor Balance & Hard to Hold On To
customer_reviews.text: I previously had a Oster Electric Knife for about 20 yrs & loved it, I bought this product back at the end of August 2017 and do not like it as it is does not have a good balance, The surface of the knife is so smooth that it is hard to hold onto when your cutting and even harder when your hand gets grease from the meat your cutting. I have just ordered a replacement in the form of an Oster & hope it is of the quality of my previous Oster knife.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Hawley

customer_reviews.title: Hamilton Beach electric knife
customer_reviews.text: Have not used product yet . But I am impressed very much on the product .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handle is too large
customer_reviews.text: I have always been very careful when buying products from Amazon. I carefully read the reviews and product details. I should have believed the reviews that said this knife is too large and difficult to handle. I have large hands and thought this would not be a problem for me. Unfortunately, after using the knife for less than a minute my hand is hurting from trying to hold the handle and the On button. I have had electric knives in the past that have been wonderful, but after years of use they had to be replaced. I suspect the manufacturer has to deal with safety regulations. In any event, I can't use this knife and am sorry I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: My Sunbeam electric knife lasted over ten years. Unfortunately, the company no longer makes them. The Hamilton Beach literally couldn't slice my homemade bread. It was also difficult to keep pressure on the power switch.
customer_reviews.author: Ann M.

customer_reviews.title: not having it kind of sucked. So with a little research
customer_reviews.text: My old electric knife disappear about 6 months ago, and since we entertain a lot, not having it kind of sucked. So with a little research, I chose this unit from Hamilton Beach. It works flawlessly. Great purchase especially since I also smoke turkeys and also cook them in an oil-less fryer.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Williams

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: Nice knife but picture was deceiving and description was not obvious. Thought it was battery operated.
customer_reviews.author: Me Dye

customer_reviews.title: Buy a better product .... this knife was a totally unusuable!
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight ...... very difficult to use. ..... ended up using a old carving knife. I wish I could return it ..... very poor product
customer_reviews.author: nancy mckinless

customer_reviews.title: THE PERFCT KNIFE!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect electric knife. I bought it for my husband just before Christmas and we used it on our Prime Rib... It was outstanding. The blade is the perfect length, and it's powerful enough to cut right thru the meat. The case it comes with to store it in is perfect too. Can't go wrong with this one!
customer_reviews.author: ShelleyLynnShin

customer_reviews.title: Dull and wimpy.
customer_reviews.text: This knife is so dull! I tried cutting a boneless ham. The first piece came off great. The second one, okay and by the third slice it was already dull. I pushed harder and the blade would bend. Several slices later I had a mess. The blades are serrated so I am not sure if you can even sharpen them.
customer_reviews.author: Simple Sally

customer_reviews.title: Worked good to cut a memory foam mattress
customer_reviews.text: Worked good to cut a memory foam mattress. Had to flip it over to cut the other side. I think the mattress is 8" thick.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Tried slicing a ham and it just won't cut worth a diddly. Took out an old electric knife that I had planned on discarding and it worked just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well received!
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for our son. He loves it. It made his work of carving a turkey and ham quick and easy. We have an older model we love too. It's easy to wash the knife blades, dry and store. Wished ours had a case to put it in like this one does. The make great gifts no matter the season.
customer_reviews.author: T.TTop Contributor: Quilting

customer_reviews.title: Great knife but...
customer_reviews.text: Great knife, only one complaint is with the button on the bottom it's a little akward. I think if the button was on the side it might be a little easier to use. But other than that very happy with this knife.
customer_reviews.author: michelle

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Great price! Easy to use, great having a case to store it in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed with this electric knife!
customer_reviews.text: I do not like this knife at all! My husband bought it to replace a Toastmaster which we had for about thirty years. It can hardly cut through a roast beef and I usually end up switching to a regular knife. In addition to it not cutting well, it is totally uncomfortable to hold. My hand is killing me by the time I am done. I have used it about four or five times now, thinking I would give it a chance to break it in, but the more I use it, the less I like it. I would definitely not recommend this knife to anybody!
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Mattes

customer_reviews.title: Very Sharp and Fast Cutting!
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp, very fast cutting! Comfortable grip. The included fork is a nice addition to the knife. Works great with soft bread fresh out of the oven or slicing that big turkey for dinner. Easy operation and looks nice too!
customer_reviews.author: C.Dobis

customer_reviews.title: My grandfather loved this slicer
customer_reviews.text: My grandfather loved this slicer. It was definitely an upgrade from his old one and he was impressed with the little plastic case it came in. The quality is very nice and it does what it's suppose to. For the price you can't be to picky.
customer_reviews.author: Reveam29

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this knife. Everything about it is cheaply made including the case. The worst part is that it doesn't slice, it shreds. The blades wobble and tears up what your trying to cut. Spend a few more dollars and buy something with better quality.
customer_reviews.author: M.L.

customer_reviews.title: Probably better for meat than upholstery foam
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to cut foam seat pillows. I had a bit of a struggle because I purchased rather thick squares of upholstry foam, but the knife did cut....just not the slick straight cuts I would have preferred. I don't know how it works on meat because I only used it on upholstery foam
customer_reviews.author: Alice L. Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought it
customer_reviews.text: Like how easy it was use Glad I bought it Glad I bought it
customer_reviews.author: Donald Collins

customer_reviews.title: Cut easily through prime rib
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as expected. Cut easily through prime rib. The storage case makes for easy storing.
customer_reviews.author: M. Thayer

customer_reviews.title: Yes, it met my expectations. However, wish ...
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it met my expectations. However, wish it wouldn't only come in a set including the meat fork, which I didn't need. I felt I bought and paid for an item that was unnecessary for me. I have used the knife for cutting bread as well as meat and it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I had been using a cheap no name electric knife for the last few years and finally decided to purchase a better one. I love the case that this knife comes in. Works very well. I also like how they positioned the button that releases the blades, it does not cause me to release the blades every time I use the knife like my last one did.
customer_reviews.author: Nixon72

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: Awkward Trigger, too hard to pull.....you must pull the trigger back, not up like should be. Bad angle and if your hand gets greasy....forget it.
customer_reviews.author: Electronics guy

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic bread knife
customer_reviews.text: I make no-knead bread every week and we always smushed it when cutting it. With this knife, it's like cutting through butter. We can do super thin slices if we want, too. Wish we'd bought this a couple of years ago!
customer_reviews.author: avid reader

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product
customer_reviews.text: I've owned 2 other electric knives and this was my first Hamilton Beach knife. When I took it out of the box, I was impressed with its heft and black and chrome look. However, I was disappointed with it on the very first cut I made. I could not believe my eyes because it shredded my turkey roast as it made the cut and left large striations on both sides of the meat. Furthermore, it was impossible to make slices with any precision. It's going back in the box for a return immediately. I would not give it even one Star.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Comforto

customer_reviews.title: Good item
customer_reviews.text: so far works as expected. love having the case to keep it all together, wish it had a lock button so I didn't have to try and \hold it down, but understand the safety concerns of that
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Good knife, not great
customer_reviews.text: It is a good knife. Like the case, the fork and the way it cuts, The only complaint is the possition of the ON & OFF power button. Because it's on the top, it makes it a little difficult to apply downward pressure. It would be much better on the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: James Malis

customer_reviews.title: very excellent works very well
customer_reviews.text: Very, very excellent works very well. If you need buy an electric knife this is very good
customer_reviews.author: Gilmar

customer_reviews.title: Junk carver
customer_reviews.text: Did not operate nor did it fit the hand well. Horrible design. Power button could not be operated while in the hand. Through it strait into trash can. Not worth time or effort to return. Junk
customer_reviews.author: Steve Gagliardi

product_meta.title: Hamilton Beach Electric Knife for Carving Meats, Poultry, Bread, Crafting Foam and More, Storage Case and Serving Fork Included, Black
product_meta.description: Color:BlackHamilton Beach Electric knife with storage case slicing, simplified. Make your holiday roast even more impressive by serving It perfectly cut. Or slice your favorite artisan breads, meats and cheese to create a deli classic at home. With a comfortable handle that’s easy to grip, the Hamilton Beach electric knife lets you make precise slices with little effort. The stainless steel blade never needs sharpening and removes easily for quick cleaning. The included stainless steel fork lets you go straight from carving to serving. And the storage case makes it simple to keep everything together in one small space. Key features: space-saving storage case Stainless steel blade and fork perfect for carving meat and slicing all types of bread effortlessly cut meats cutting a turkey, ham or roast beef can be a big undertaking with a basic carving knife. The oscillating, double blade and power of the electric knife simplifies this task, letting you make precise cuts with little work. Perfectly slice breads from a warm, crispy baguette to a homemade loaf of light White, the Hamilton Beach electric knife lets you slice a wide variety of breads without compromising their Texture. Keep all parts together don’t Scramble to find Parts again. The included storage case keeps the knife, blade and fork protected and easily accessible in one place. Stainless steel blade and fork carve and serve with the included blade and fork. Ergonomic handle designed for Comfort, the handle gives you better control no matter what you’re cutting.
feature_bullets: Effortlessly cut meats: cutting a turkey, ham or roast beef can be a big undertaking with a basic carving knife. The oscillating, double blade and power of the electric knife simplifies this task, letting you make precise cuts with little work.
Perfectly slice bread: from a warm, crispy Baguette to a homemade loaf of light White, The Hamilton Beach electric knife lets you slice a wide variety of breads without compromising their texture
Keep all parts together: don’t Scramble to find Parts again. The included storage case keeps the knife, blade and fork protected and easily accessible in one space-saving place
Stainless steel blade and fork: carve and serve with the included blade and fork.
Ergonomic Handle: designed for Comfort, The handle gives you better control no matter what you’re cutting.
Great crafting knife: can be used as a foam cutter that cuts and slices crafting foam with ease.
